intro: Pedicularis siphonantha var. birmanica, commonly known as the Burmese lousewort, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant has slender, erect stems and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and mountainous regions. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for studies on parasitic plant adaptations and ecological interactions.
